description.title: PHEV rechargeable hybrid new vehicle preparation: description

descmetadata.siename: PHEV rechargeable hybrid new vehicle preparation: description

description.title: RECHARGABLE HYBRID VEHICLES (PHEV): New Vehicle PREPARATION

para.b: Presence of OTS (blue and red): □ YES / □ NO
Connected services to be activated: □ YES / □ NO
The vehicle preparation must be carried out only three to five days before the scheduled delivery date in order to avoid damage to the lead 12 V battery

noteR.para: If the preparation is carried out more than five days before the vehicle delivery to the customer, or in the event of a quality block (either by an external centre or by the dealership), then the logistics mode must be reactivated by pulling the consumer cut-off shunt at the end of the New Vehicle preparation
This will prevent the acceleration of damage to the 12 V battery before the final delivery of the vehicle to the customer.

description.title: TRANSPORTATION OF THE VEHICLE TO THE PREPARATION POINT

ul.li: Before starting, deactivate the logistics mode (battery discharge protection) to switch to customer mode by pushing hard on the consumer cut-off shunt

When starting and during this driving phase, ensure that there is no fault such as:
Warning light or message on the instrument panel
Abnormal noise
Leak (passenger compartment interior/exterior)
If the vehicle does not start, transfer it to the workshop

description.title: REMOVAL OF PROTECTION – WASHING – CHECKING THE EXTERNAL APPEARANCE OF THE VEHICLE AND OPENING ELEMENTS

ul.li: Remove the protections, rubber pieces and adhesives

Wash the bodywork
Never use a high-pressure washer in the engine compartment, underneath the vehicle or on the charging socket while the flap is open
Bodywork (impacts, alignment, etc.)
Paintwork (scratches, stains, chipping, etc.)
Door mirrors and windows/Windscreen (stains, chipping, cracking, etc.)
Operation of all opening elements

CHECK THE LEVELS:
Coolant
Brake fluid
Windscreen washer fluid
Engine oil

li.b: Connect the charger to the lead 12 V battery

ul.li: Check if the valve caps are present
Check and inflate the tyres to the recommended pressures according to the model
Reinitialise the tyre pressure monitoring system
Check the luggage compartment light

descbody.para: Refer to the Volatile Equipment Sheet:

ul.li: Check the presence of the standard and booster charging cable (optional) and its instructions
Check the presence of the inflation kit and the tyre repair aerosol (depending on the model)
Check the presence of the toolkit

description.title: VEHICLE EXTERIOR: CHECKS WITH PASSENGER COMPARTMENT CONTROLS

ul.li:
CHECK THE OPERATION OF THE LIGHTS (using the mirrors):
Brake lights
Hazard warning lights
Reversing lights
Dipped-beam headlights
Main beam headlights
Direction indicator lights
Side lights
Daytime running lights
Front fog light
Rear fog light
Number plate lights
Check the locking and unlocking from outside using the key/card
Check the opening and closing of the charging flap
Check the operation of the front/rear wipers
Check the operation of the reversing camera or the four cameras linked to the 360° vision function (by shifting into reverse gear)

description.title: VEHICLE INTERIOR: CHECKS WITH PASSENGER COMPARTMENT CONTROLS

ul.li:
Interior lights: (depending on the model)
Glovebox light
Storage compartment lights
Courtesy lights
Front and rear ceiling lights, reading light
Ambient lighting (door panels, centre console, under the dashboard, etc.)
Lights on reminder sound alert (when the door is opened)
Using the rear view mirrors
Control to lock and unlock the vehicle from the inside
Using the seats (including access to the rear seats)
Adjusting the steering wheel (depth and height)
Rear doors safety lock
Check the ventilation in all positions and deactivate the air recirculation mode
Check the multimedia language and change it if necessary
Set the clock (depending on the model)
Check the operation of the radio
Reset the display of the service interval range (mileage/time) and average consumption
Initialise the windows and the sunroof and check their operation
Check the operation of the pedestrian warning

Check the activation of the E-Call system
The AUTO SOS warning light should appear in green and stay on (RENAULT range)
The status indicator light should appear in green and stay on (DACIA range)
Do not press the SOS button

noteR.para: At this stage of vehicle preparation, if:
• Delivery to the end customer is scheduled in more than five days
• Or the vehicle is subject to a quality block
□ Reactivate the logistics mode (battery discharge protection) by pulling the consumer cut-off shunt

entry.para: Indicate the faults encountered and the operations carried out on the New Vehicle Delivery Quality sheet

para.b: (or any other form that may exist for outsourced preparations)

description.title: RECHARGEABLE HYBRID VEHICLES (PHEV): NEW VEHICLE FINISHING

noteR.para: LESS THAN FIVE DAYS BEFORE DELIVERY TO THE END CUSTOMER

para.b: FINISHING TO BE CARRIED OUT IN THE DEALERSHIP OR BY THE SERVICE PROVIDER RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING DELIVERY TO A FLEET CUSTOMER
Presence of OTS (blue and red): □ YES / □ NO

ul.li:
Check the position of the consumer cut-off shunt to ensure that the vehicle is in customer mode
Reminder on switching to customer mode: push hard on the consumer cut-off shunt
Make sure the traction battery is charged to 80% and if not charge it (the traction battery can be charged at any time except during the washing step)

If steps 1.1 à 1.8 have been outsourced:
Wash the vehicle if necessary
Clean the windows
Vacuum the front seats and check the condition of the rear seats and the luggage compartment
If needed, clean the instrument panel and internal trims

b.u: 12 V BATTERY: checks can only be carried out at the beginning of the preparation if they are carried out less than five days before the delivery date

ul.li:
Check the age of the vehicle:
if the vehicle age (MADC date) is over one year: transfer the vehicle to the workshop for replacement of the 12 V battery

Checks using the diagnostic tool: (MASTER 3 not affected)
Put the vehicle under forced After ignition feed (depending on model specificity), connect the VCI-ADT probe to the OBD socket then launch the OCV measurement sequence on the diagnostic software
Read the OCV value on the diagnostic tool, delete the faults then close the session before disconnecting the probe on the vehicle
If the value is below 12.0 V, replace the 12 V battery
If the value is over 12.0 V, charge the 12 V battery until the smiley appears on the charger

Check the presence/fitting of the accessories requested by the customer (see FQLVN)
If the booster charging cable is provided as an accessory, check that it is present along with its instructions
Fitting standard or accessory equipment does not require a visit to the workshop (hubcaps, aerial, mats)
Fit the number plates (depending on the country)
Remove all remaining protections except that of the driver's seat
Check the availability of the duplicate key or card
Check the compliance of the practical guide (model, language)

Deal with non-compliances that can be taken care of during the preparation (small scratches that can be removed by polishing, stains, etc.)
For matt paints, any touch-up must be done in the workshop: it is prohibited to use abrasive products such as polish
EASY LINK – OPENR LINK – MEDIA NAV LIVE: activate the connected services according to the system-specific methods
OPENR LINK - MEDIA NAV LIVE: then perform a "factory reset" to restore the system to the factory settings from the "ADMINISTRATOR" profile selected on the multimedia screen
Reset the on-board computer
End of procedure: switch off the vehicle

entry.para: Indicate the faults encountered and the operations carried out on the New Vehicle Delivery Quality sheet
